abstract.text: A continuous gesture recognizer that interprets panning gestures.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Clients of this class can, in their action methods, query the
object for the current translation of the gesture (
) and the velocity of the translation (
). They can specify a viewâ€™s coordinate system to use for the translation and velocity values. Clients can also reset the translation to a desired value.
A panning gesture is continuous. The user must press one or more fingers on a view while panning it. The gesture begins (
) when the user moves the minimum number of fingers allowed (
) enough distance for recognition as a pan. It changes (
) when the user moves a finger while pressing with the minimum number of fingers. It ends (
) when the user lifts all fingers.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
The base class for concrete gesture recognizers.
The gesture recognizer has received touch objects recognized as a continuous gesture.
The gesture recognizer has received touches recognized as a change to a continuous gesture.
The gesture recognizer has received touches recognized as the end of a continuous gesture.
A continuous gesture recognizer that interprets pointer movement over a view.
A continuous gesture recognizer that interprets long-press gestures.
A continuous gesture recognizer that interprets panning gestures.
A scroll type mask that enables recognition of scroll events.
The maximum number of fingers that can touch the view for gesture recognition.
The minimum number of fingers that can touch the view for gesture recognition.
Sets the translation value in the coordinate system of the specified view.
Interprets the pan gesture in the coordinate system of the specified view.
Interprets the velocity of the pan gesture in the coordinate system of the specified view.
A continuous gesture recognizer that interprets pinching gestures involving two touches.
A continuous gesture recognizer that interprets rotation gestures involving two touches.
A continuous gesture recognizer that interprets panning gestures that start near an edge of the screen.
Constants that define the type of the scroll.
A bit mask identifying the scroll type of a pan gesture.
A discrete gesture recognizer that interprets swiping gestures in one or more directions.
A discrete gesture recognizer that interprets single or multiple taps.
Enhance user feedback for your iPadOS app with a hover preview for
Apple Pencil input.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Adopting hover support for Apple Pencil

abstract.text: Discover how to use multiple gesture recognizers on the same view.
Trace the movement of fingers around the screen, and apply that movement to your content.
Use gesture recognizers to simplify touch handling and create a consistent user experience.
Enrich your appâ€™s user experience by supporting standard and custom gesture interaction.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Supporting gesture interaction in your apps

abstract.text: The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
